chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Next, we will move to our practice question 8.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: In practice question 8, I have been given the activity to create a search option

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: which is redirected to Google.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Just like we did for YouTube, we are going to do something similar for Google.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: For Google, I have to create an input box and a submit button.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: I can type anything in this input box.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Let's say I typed Apple.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: As soon as I click on submit, the Google page will open

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: in which the same text will be searched as I did in my normal page.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: I have to do something similar to what we did for YouTube.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: So, first of all, we will create a form in our HTML.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Now, I have to decide where the form data will be redirected.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: For that, let's see where the data is redirected on Google.com.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: I am going to Google.com.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Let's say I searched for Apple.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: A big URL is being displayed.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Let's copy and paste it here.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: In this big URL, the starting part is only useful for me.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: I have to make sure that the last part is automatically added.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: So, I have to ignore the last part.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: In fact, I will remove it.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: We will add this last part in our action.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: So, the action will be this thing.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: I know that the name of my query should be qkEqual.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: So, I am going to create an input element in my form.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: I am going to type text equal and name it q.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Along with this, we can also add a placeholder.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Search in Google.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Next, I will make a button and name it search.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Let's save it.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: And let's refresh it.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: So, I have created a search in Google.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: I have typed Apple.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: As soon as I click on search, my query will be searched in Google.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: So, I don't have to do anything.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: I just needed a simple URL.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: We can do the same thing with Reddit.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: There are a few other websites that can be recreated with this.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: So, this is a way to explore.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: I am giving you this as a homework problem.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: You can take out 5-10 minutes of your time.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: Pause the video and you can either go to Reddit or any other random website.

chunks.title: Practice Qs
chunks.text: You can see how you can use the name attribute to implement a search query.

text: Next, we will move to our practice question 8. In practice question 8, I have been given the activity to create a search option which is redirected to Google. Just like we did for YouTube, we are going to do something similar for Google. For Google, I have to create an input box and a submit button. I can type anything in this input box. Let's say I typed Apple. As soon as I click on submit, the Google page will open in which the same text will be searched as I did in my normal page. I have to do something similar to what we did for YouTube. So, first of all, we will create a form in our HTML. Now, I have to decide where the form data will be redirected. For that, let's see where the data is redirected on Google.com. I am going to Google.com. Let's say I searched for Apple. A big URL is being displayed. Let's copy and paste it here. In this big URL, the starting part is only useful for me. I have to make sure that the last part is automatically added. So, I have to ignore the last part. In fact, I will remove it. We will add this last part in our action. So, the action will be this thing. I know that the name of my query should be qkEqual. So, I am going to create an input element in my form. I am going to type text equal and name it q. Along with this, we can also add a placeholder. Search in Google. Next, I will make a button and name it search. Let's save it. And let's refresh it. So, I have created a search in Google. I have typed Apple. As soon as I click on search, my query will be searched in Google. So, I don't have to do anything. I just needed a simple URL. We can do the same thing with Reddit. There are a few other websites that can be recreated with this. So, this is a way to explore. I am giving you this as a homework problem. You can take out 5-10 minutes of your time. Pause the video and you can either go to Reddit or any other random website. You can see how you can use the name attribute to implement a search query.
